subject: Re: [junit] Counting assertions
msgSnippet: ... I was, but somebody beat me to it :-) And indeed, I believe AOP is the best way to add this feature, as your code shows. -- Cédric [Non-text portions of
messageBody:
On 10/16/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric Beust ? wrote:
>
> >>Ooh look, I figured it out:
> >>
> >>find /c/project/ -name \*.java | xargs grep assert |
> >>wc
> >>
> >>
> >This won't tell you how many asserts have been invoked at runtime.
> >
> >
> Cedric, I actually thought you'd suggest aspect for this. :-)


I was, but somebody beat me to it :-)

And indeed, I believe AOP is the best way to add this feature, as your code
shows.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
